text:
This just in. Wolf watch, the environmental
group that funds the radio collar studies of

wolf packs in the park, has just issued a
press release claiming that they have

recovered radio collars from the Prospect
Peak wolf pack, and they say that the data

indicates that the wolves could have been
killed on Governor John Dutton's Yellowstone
Ranch, which borders the park.

So far, no comment from the governor's
office.
When it rains, it pours.
Huh?

They never reached out for comment, and
nothing indicated they were killed on your
ranch. I mean, this is.
It's a hit piece, Clara.
They smell blood in the water.
Who smells blood?
Everyone.

Well, maybe you should take him to the train
station.

For what? Can I have a minute with my
daughter?
Have a seat.
No. I'll stand.
What do you want to know?
What is it exactly?

It's a trash can for everyone who's attacked
us.

It lays in a jurisdictional dead zone in a
county with a population of exactly zero.

Hence no jury of your peers and no court for
a change in venue.
Why are you so surprised?

What do you think? The men who attacked you
in your office and attacked our ranch went?

Shocked, we found a way to circumvent the
consequences of defending ourselves.
I'm shocked. We need away.
But we do. We always have.

Unless we're willing to walk away from 120
years of our family bleeding into this
ground. We always will.
Jamie knows about it.
Yes.
Okay, I'm going to repeat that, Dad.
Jamie knows about it.
I'm aware of Beth.

He will use everything that he knows to
destroy you.
He has made it clear.
Yes, I believe he has.

If there is a place our enemies go and nobody
ever knows they went, Dad.
And they will never come back.
And I think that's the place for Jamie.
What do you think, daddy?
